content.question: The center of mass of a uniform meterstick is placed on a fulcrum. Two objects of known mass, <math alttext="m sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="m sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, are hung at known positions on the meterstick. One end of a string is attached to one end of the meterstick, and the other end of the string is looped around a pulley and connected to hanging object <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of unknown mass, as shown in the figure. The meterstick does not rotate and is level with the horizontal. Which of the following measuring devices, if any, should be used to make measurements to determine the unknown mass of object <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>? Justify your selection.

choices.label: A ruler, because the length of the string that is looped around the pulley should be measured.

A protractor, because the angle between the force due to gravity exerted on objects <math alttext="m sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="m sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and the distance between where the force is applied and the tip of the fulcrum should be measured.
A motion sensor, because the distance per unit of time of object <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> should be measured.

No additional equipment or measurements are needed, because the force due to gravity exerted on objects <math alttext="m sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="m sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and the distance between where the force is applied and the tip of the fulcrum are already known.
